name: jdhenry105
text: How could that not make sense?

name: red_dawn
text: Roast Beef, voice of reason even in Ray's mind.

name: evilbobikus
text: This is the sort of bond that really good friends have.  When I have difficult decisions instead of an angel and devil on my shoulder I have one of my more reasonable friends and then one of my drinking buddies.

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
Where's Ray's Brother/Sister? I mean, "Little Nephew" implies child of sibling...

I'm assuming it's Ray's sister, and she's strung out on blow. Ray's mom enables her habit.

name: flynn
text: Like most ladies of taste and class, Ray's mom has a few skeletons in her closet.

name: spinynorman
text:
Jack Nicholson was raised thinking his mother was his sister and his grandparents his parents.

It would account for a lot in old Jack, and it would make sense with Ray.

name: lawbot
text: Have you commented on each strip?

name: spinynorman
text: Nope, don't think so. There's a lot of them.

name: belgand
text: I need to know now how Ray and Jack Nicholson and fundamentally different. Aside from being a cartoon cat. This is because they are not.

name: pigeon_street
text: His mother. His sister. His mother. His sister.

name: puguglypress
text: SLAP

name: singtralala
text:
haha, awesome.
also, your avatar kicks most asses

name: dasilodavi
text: See, if a spaghetti's dad can be a steak and no spaghetti, then Little Nephew can be not a nephew.

name: shinkusan
text: It was my understanding that Little Nephew's NAME is Little Nephew. There've been similarly unusual monikers in Achewood.

name: splendorr
text:
There is an answer to this question just a few comics earlier, and also on Little Nephew's bizzlog.

The answer? Is Charles Smuckles.

name: lolsworth
text: Surely "blizzog" is a more aesthetically pleasing fuck this sentence?

name: apricotta
text: I'm assuming it's Ray's brother, cause Little Nephew's last name is Smuckles.

name: zapatos
text: LN is his son, but Ray can't cope with the loss of his wife's passing.  So he just goes with Uncle Ray and has never told LN the truth.

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by chagment, Pseudochron, fosters, goocifer, tttt2, rascaldom)

name: straw
text: The important thing here is that you're trying

name: achilleselbow
text: What exactly would constitute a bite?

name: geysershitdick
text: Hitting something with both halves of your mouth at the same time.

name: mugi
text: I like this comment a lot.

text: I like how you only ever comment on comments.

text: i like how you researched that.

orange

things

name: trevor
text: The look on Ray's face as he is about to sit on the nozzle is so good.

name: berami
text: A perfect mix of horror and determination.  He's gotta do it!

name: horace_lung
text: What does it for me is that Ray's analogy is even more brilliant than Teodor's vocabulary. Ray: the Cat's a genius.

name: deancain29
text: Teodor's all sweaty. does that upset anyone else?

name: epicurus
text: Hey, YOU try doing parkour for a while and not getting sweaty - especially when you have to jump over cars and shit but you're only like two feet tall.

name: yingkaixing
text: He used to be a stuffed animal. How can he sweat? Maybe a wizard did it.

name: red_dawn
text: If that is your biggest problem with the logic in Achewood, then you aren't paying much attention.

name: littlefatdog
text: Yea, there are several strips where T�odor is doing things that are decidedly un-teddy bear-like. For example, in this one you can see him walking around and talking !

name: littlefatdog
text: Sorry, I meant to link to [url=http://achewood.com/index.php?date=11082005]this one[/card].

name: littlefatdog
text: Wow. Too bad you can't lame yourself because it would make me feel better.

text: there you go. glad to be of service.

text: A comment left by molesticide was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Bourbonsamurai, jthompson, endstate)

name: atticusonline
text: mmm good ol steakfuck

name: mangtastic
text: i think you mean "steak FUCK"

name: lolsworth
text: Lean, ground fuck steak.

name: coldfrog
text:
Man, how do I always forget about this arc. Every read through, I get through this and am like "This is hilarious! I should quote this all the time!" and then I end up making some mention of worms being tiny little steaks and hit a total tangent.

Anyway. Favorite strip of this arc.

name: ford
text: I love that Achwood has never once shown a child being raised with anything approaching responsibility.

name: kilroywashere
text: I beg to differ

name: wittyname
text: I don't see the responsibility.

name: kilroywashere
text: Hey, that ukulele might be Baby's college fund one day.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Gub!

name: catbark
text: 'This waaaay...' made me spurt tea onto my keyboard. Totally worth it.

name: yearsinhotclaws
text: I love how Onstad writes Teodor as TACodor in alt texts

name: mugi
text: I've been seeing that a lot; I think it's an encoding issue.

name: yourmalarky
text: The dialog in this plotline, especially anything ray says or people try to say to ray is incredible fiction. It's hard to remember that this is just a comic

That is BUDDHA LEVEL WISDOM

text: i hate to do this, but can someone please explain this to me?

name: echidnaboy
text: When Teodor uses logic and long words, Ray feels like he is receiving a Yale enema. In other words, the intellectual elitism of Yale University is being forcibly introduced into his body. Via his anus.

text:
thank you. heres a shiny apple:

[IMGS OFF]

text: racism.  noblesse oblige.

text: racism.  noblesse oblige.

name: conor23
text: This strip just made me laugh until I cried, and I have read it several times before. The last 2 frames are golden.

name: tellumo
text: Whenever Pat talks at all, I feel like I'm sittin' on the nozzle of a big metal tank that says TALK LIKE A DICK SCHOOL.

name: streever
text: I know I've seen this gag before. What other comic is "I feel like I'm sittin' on the nozzle of a big metal tank that says Yale."?
